title: Error: Redis is not installed... And cannot import name '_gi'

labels.name: setup
labels.description: Issues with getting Auto-GPT setup on local machines

body:
### ⚠️ Search for existing issues first ⚠️

- [X] I have searched the existing issues, and there is no existing issue for my problem

### Which Operating System are you using?

Linux

### Which version of Auto-GPT are you using?

Stable (branch)

### GPT-3 or GPT-4?

GPT-3.5

### Steps to reproduce 🕹

First, I had another issue- [#2581](https://github.com/Significant-Gravitas/Auto-GPT/issues/2581), someone named [ntindle](https://github.com/ntindle) closed it with a comment and his advice didn't help, and still he kept the issue closed.
Hopefully, this time this issue will remain open until the issue is **solved**.

1. Download zip file of stable version.
2. Extract it.
3. cd into it.
4. install requirements.
5. run it:
`python -m autogpt --speak --gpt3only`

### Current behavior 😯

```
Error: Redis is not installed. Please install redis-py to use Redis as a memory backend.
Error: Redis is not installed. Please install redis-py to use Redis as a memory backend.
Speak Mode:  ENABLED
GPT3.5 Only Mode:  ENABLED
Welcome back!  Would you like me to return to being Bella?
Continue with the last settings?
Name:  Bella
Role:  an AI designed to help me make additional incomes with the goal of increasing my net worth.
Goals: ['Increase net worth', 'Help me with my life and tasks and serve me as good as possible', 'Make my life easier.', 'Develop successful businesses and manage them autonomously', 'Think of the easiest, most profitable and high potential ways to make money that can be automated and with almost no human work required']
Continue (y/n): Exception in thread Thread-1 (speak):
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/threading.py", line 1016, in _bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.10/threading.py", line 953, in run
    self._target(*self._args, **self._kwargs)
  File "/home/w01v3n/git/Auto-GPT/autogpt/speech/say.py", line 34, in speak
    success = VOICE_ENGINE.say(text, voice_index)
  File "/home/w01v3n/git/Auto-GPT/autogpt/speech/base.py", line 33, in say
    return self._speech(text, voice_index)
  File "/home/w01v3n/git/Auto-GPT/autogpt/speech/eleven_labs.py", line 80, in _speech
    playsound("speech.mpeg", True)
  File "/home/w01v3n/.local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/playsound.py", line 91, in _playsoundNix
    import gi
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/gi/__init__.py", line 42, in <module>
    from . import _gi
ImportError: cannot import name '_gi' from partially initialized module 'gi' (most likely due to a circular import) (/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/gi/__init__.py)

```

### Expected behavior 🤔

Should work without errors or warnings. I want to use redis because it's a free, locally hosted database server. And it can and should be used in my case as the memory backend.

### Your prompt 📝

```yaml
ai_goals:
- Increase net worth
- Help me with my life and tasks and serve me as good as possible
- Make my life easier.
- Develop successful businesses and manage them autonomously
- Think of the easiest, most profitable and high potential ways to make money that
  can be automated and with almost no human work required
ai_name: Bella
ai_role: an AI designed to help me make additional incomes with the goal of increasing
  my net worth.
```


### Your Logs 📒

